response.job_title: SAP Warehouse and Production Consultant en Chr. Hansen Holding A/S
response.summary:
Industrial Engineer with a Master Degree in Supply Chain Management. I have experience in: SAP implementation projects (logistics modules), Supply Chain process implementation in Factories and Distribution Warehouses, Sales and Operations Planning S&OP, Transportation and distribution planning (DRP) and continuous improvement.

I have knowledge in Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma (Green Belt certified) and APICS Certification in Supply Chain Management. I have experience as SAP consultant in the modules MM-IM, LE-WM, LO-BM and interfaces with PP, QM, SD (Inventory Management, Warehouse Management, Batch Management, Production, Quality Management, Sales and Distribution) and electronic invoice functionalities for Brasil.
response.skills: Cadena de suministro, Administración de la cadena de suministro, Logística, Liderazgo de equipos, Gestión de proyectos, SAP, Lean manufacturing, Project Management, Estrategia empresarial, Seis Sigma, SAP ERP, Inglés, Sistemas de planificación de recursos empresariales, Análisis, Microsoft Excel, Ingeniería, 5S, Español, Planeamiento de proyectos, Gestión de almacenes

profile_positions.title: SAP Project Manager & SAP Warehouse Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Implementation of SAP modules MM Materials management, WM Warehouse Management, YM Yard Management as part of the opening of the beer manufacturing plant for Heineken Colombia, meeting the specific requirements of the business as an industrial user of goods in a the Free Trade Zone, including Synchronization interfaces with their inventory control system (Piciz).
The WM Implementation Includes RF functionalities, dangerous and controled goods storage, voice Picking for raw materials, Value-added Services orders for staging areas and dock determination, and vehicule scheduling with SMS notifications.
profile_positions.title: SAP LE-WM/YM Intern Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction in the best conditions of service, cost and quality, performing the coordination, supervision, optimization and control of End to End supply chain processes.
1. Direct the logistics teams of the different distribution centers. 
2. Supervise the daily activities of management and custody of inventory. 
3. Manage and coordinate the logistics of launching for new lines of business. 
4. Implement the necessary improvement actions, in order to reduce costs and delivery times. 
5. Coordinate and control the corporate procurement processes, tracking the status of orders in national and international transit. 
6. Manage the different logistics operators involved in the supply chain. 
7. Carry out monitoring, statistics and reports to control and minimize the cost of operations. 
8. Provide quick and timely solutions to customers complains.
profile_positions.title: Operations and Logistics Chief

profile_positions.description:
Consultant in charge of the design of Supply Chain logistics models, implementation and continuous improvement, using SAP as enabling tool for processes, in charge of the functional management and customizing of the modules of Warehouse Management WM, Inventory Management IM, Batch Management BM, Sales and Distribution SD, performing the following tasks:
1.	Participation in Strategic Corporative Projects with high impact (Distribution Centers expansion, new logistic models for inventory management and traceability, Opening of own and contracted Factories, version update of corporative ERP, Web sales logistic model implementation).
2.	Multifunctional teams leader (Belcorp and external consultants) for the development of projects in charge.
3.	Project Manager following the PMI methodology.
4.	Responsible for the implementation of new SAP R/3 functionalities, improvement to current processes and transactions for the Supply Chain area (Advisor, processes analyze, processes and tools design, implementation).
5.	Responsible for support and problems solving.
profile_positions.title: Consultant in Logistics and Inventory Management – SAP Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Internship focused on the Diagnostic, Formulation and Development of the project in mention, applying Six Sigma problem solving methodology and based on current market trend in environment protection implementing Green Lean Manufacturing, with the following objectives:
1.	Change manufacturing processes, so that they include environmental considerations.
2.	Reduce waste generation in manufacturing processes.
3.	Pre-treat dangerous waste in order to reduce subsequent costs of waste disposal.
4.	Determine which the best country is, in order to execute the importation and disposal of waste from foreign trade zone, specially toxic and dangerous waste.
5.	Improve the supply chain of production waste management in order to reduce associated costs with Green Lean Manufacturing implementation (Minimize wasted movements, Reducing transportation, reduce excess waste inventory in Collection Centers, Reduce waiting time).
profile_positions.title: Project of Production Waste Management Costs Reduction – Internship

company.name: Centro Colombiano de Tecnologías del Transporte CCTT

profile_positions.company: Centro Colombiano de Tecnologías del Transporte CCTT
profile_positions.description: Junior researcher in charge of the operational labors of Technological Innovation Projects formulation and management for transport. I was in charge of reviewing the market and technology trends for transportation, bibliographic research, projects formulation documentation, propose projects to Colciencias, budget and timelines estimation, tasks and research team coordination.
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher in Technological Innovation

profile_positions.description:
As part of the logistics team of the company, my experience was focused towards these missions:

1.	Being in charge of the distribution operations in the country for a range of products, managing the supply chain from factories to customers, the inventory levels in distribution warehouses and participating in the S&OP process with the preparation, following and adjustment of sales forecast in the short term (0 – 3 months).
2.	Member of the project team for launching of products, I was in charge of the project management for the logistics and technical preparation, in charge of the integration of the multifunctional team of supply chain leaders and marketing staff.
profile_positions.title: Professional Aprentice for distribution and logistics for launching of products

profile_positions.description:
I was in charge of the development of a computer tool which could calculate production costs for gas turbines projects. That tool allows to visualize the differences between budget and real cost, making the analysis and improvement easier for manufacturing processes in order to reduce costs. This tool minimized the analysis time from 1 day to 5 minutes per machine.
I was also member of the continuous improvement team, participating in a project of 5S implementation in order to optimize the picking process and plant redistribution for a stage of the manufacturing process.
profile_positions.title: Internship in Lean Manufacturing and Continuous Improvement

education.field_of_study: Logistics, Materials, and Supply Chain Management

company.name: Chr. Hansen
company.description:
We are a leading, global bioscience company that develops natural ingredient solutions for the food, nutritional, pharmaceutical and agricultural industries. Our natural solutions play a key role in creating a food system that is resilient and prepared to feed a growing population while also minimizing its adverse climate impact – ensuring greater sustainability from farm to fork.

Our product innovation is based on almost 40,000 microbial strains – we like to refer to them as ‘good bacteria’. With the offset in our microbial platform, we are uniquely positioned to address some of society’s most pressing challenges such as climate change, food waste, global health and the overuse of antibiotics and pesticides.

Developing sustainable solutions is an integral part of Chr. Hansen’s quest to grow a better world naturally. The UN Sustainable Development Goals are an integrated part of our corporate strategy, focusing on goal 2, 3 and 12 related to zero hunger, good health and responsible consumption and production. In fact, 81% of our revenue directly supports these goals. In a commitment to curb climate change and limit the global temperature rise, Chr. Hansen has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to limit the global temperature rise, and commits to set ambitious carbon emission reduction targets.

We are humbled and proud that Chr. Hansen several times has been recognized as a global sustainability leader. For five consecutive years (2018 – 2022) Chr. Hansen has been listed on Corporate Knights’ list of the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations. The inclusion on the list was cemented in 2019, 2020 and 2022 when we were ranked respectively no. 1, 2 and 2. 

We have been delivering value to our partners – and, ultimately, end consumers worldwide – for over 145 years. We are proud that more than one billion people consume products containing our natural ingredients every day. 

Let’s grow a better world. Naturally.
